entry.title: Article Extract
entry.content:
Science&Technology

Economics

Psychology

How to get motivated even when you donâ€™t feel like it

Youâ€™ve always aspired to be a professional artist. At last, this dream may become a reality, and youâ€™re creating a portfolio to submit to art programs. But as the application deadline looms, you suddenly find yourself unmotivated, and avoiding the canvas altogether.

Why does motivation seem so fickle? And what even is it in the first place?

Psychologists define motivation as the desire or impetus to initiate and maintain a particular behavior. In other words, itâ€™s the energy that drives you to do something. And knowing the source of that drive is particularly important when it comes to understanding how to maintain it.

These motivational forces generally fall into two broad categories: intrinsic and extrinsic. Intrinsic motivation is involved when you experience an activity as an end in itself. Take a hobby, like playing video games. The experience largely explains the desire to do it. Performing tasks that feel right in the moment or that you find a meaningful, interesting, or satisfying are driven by intrinsic motivation.

Extrinsic motivation, on the other hand, refers to pursuing a task as a means to an end. While few would consider going to the dentist as an enjoyable activity, youâ€™re often motivated by the outcome of having clean, healthy teeth. Other examples of extrinsic motivation include completing a task to receive some sort of reward, whether itâ€™s praise, power, or money. Notably, these rewards tend to come later, like receiving a bonus at the end of a quarter, or winning a competition after months of training. While extrinsic rewards, like getting paid, may seem appealing, their effectiveness can be surprisingly short-lived.

For example, a 2017 study found that those who were highly focused on the outcomes of their New Yearâ€™s resolutions or driven by extrinsic motivation werenâ€™t the most likely to stick to them. What did predict persistence, however, was how much a person enjoyed pursuing their goals. In other words, youâ€™re more likely to maintain an exercise routine if you take classes you enjoy, rather than just those that build your biceps.

Years of psychology research have shown that high levels of intrinsic motivation for school, a job, or an exercise class are more likely to keep you engaged in the long run. Day-to-day actions, though, are rarely either exclusively intrinsically motivated. Study for histroy exam, for example, can be intrinsically motivated if youâ€™re curious about the culture of ancient Egypt. But extrinsic motivators may also be at play, as you aim to get good grade or feel pressure from family members to do well in school. But having multiple motivators isnâ€™t always better.

One study of military cadets found that those who were driven both by intrinsic motivators, like self-improvement, and extrinsic motivators, like the outcome of getting a good job, were overall less motivated than cadets driven by just one of these factors. As a result, these cadets performed worse and were less likely to graduate. Psychologists call this phenomenon the overjustification effect, the idea that additional extrinsic motivators can actually muddy the waters when you already have the intrinsic drive to do something.

But this is only a problem if you already find a task motivating. When youâ€™re faced with an activity you find tedious or uninteresing, adding extrinsic rewards can be beneficial. In this way, extrincis motivators can provide sufficient justification. While you may never enjoy doing the laundry, it may feel less daunting if you get praise from a loved one, or even promise yourself that youâ€™ll watch your favorite TV show when youâ€™re done folding.

Motication is complicated. And sometimes, no matter how passionate you are about a goal or hobby, finding the motivation to actually do it can be difficult. But there are things you can do to increase your drive, even when it feels impossible. Focus on building intrinsic motivation by making the task more fun in the moment. Asking a friend to join you or simply putting on your favorite playlist can give you the boost to get started and stick with your goals for the long haul.

entry.title: Approaches in Studying Effectively
entry.content:
3 Tips on How to Study Effectively

Forgetting is the friend of learning. -Robert Bjork

This approaches have great impacts on exam-oriented education, mostly have great impacts on memorizing knowledge.

The Theory of the way to transfer knowledge from short-term memory to long-term memory.

  • The repeated firing strengthens the connection between the neurous.
  • This transfers is crucial during sleep.
  • New knowledge is integrated with other related concepts you already know.

How

  • Testing yourself with flashcards and quizzes, forces you to actively retrieve knowledge, which updates and strengthens the memory.
    • Rereading textbooks and highlighting notes can generate a false sense of competence, since the information is right in front of you.
    • Testing yourself allows you to more accurately gauge what you actually know.
    • Making mistakes can actually improve learning in the long term.
    • Itâ€™s theorized that as you rack your brain for the answer, you activate relevant pieces of knowledge. The brain can better integrate this new information with what you already know after the correct answer is later revealed.

What

  • Mixing multiple topics and subjects, interleaving, or mixing the concepts you focus on in a single session, can lead to better retention than practicing a single skill.
    • Cycling through different subjects forces you brain to temporarily forget, then retrieve information, futher strengthen the memory.

When

  • Spacing your review across multiple days allows for rest and sleep between sessions.
    • While sleep, the brain is actively at work, storing and integrating knowledge in the neocortex.
    • Cramming the night before the exam may seem logical, the information wonâ€™t stick around for the long term.

Reference

  • 3 tips on how to study effectively

entry.title: IELTS Writing
entry.content:
IELTs Writing Task 1

Graph

Car ownership

The graph below gives information about car ownership in Britain from 1971 to 2007.

The graph shows changes in the number of cars per household in Great Britain over a period of 36 years.

Overall, car ownership in Britain increased between 1971 and 2007. In particular, the percentage of households with two cars rose, while the figure for households without a car fell.

In 1971, almost half of all British households did not have regular use of car. Around 44% of households had one car, but only about 7% had two cars. It was uncommon for families to own three or more cars, with around 2% of households falling into this category.

The one-car household was the most common type from the late 1970s onwards, although there was little change in the figures for the category. The biggest change was seen in the proportion of households without a car, which fell steadily over the 36-year period to around 25% in 2007. In contrast, the proportion of two-car families rose steadily, reaching about 26% in 2007, and the proportion of households with more than two cars rose by around 5%.

Internet users

The graph below shows changes in the proportion of Internet users in three different countries from 1999 to 2009

The line graph compares the percentage of people in three countries who used the Internet between 1999 and 2009.

It is clear that the proporton of the population who used the Internet in each country over the period shown. Canada experienced the fastest growth in Internet usage, whereas Mexico remained the country with lowest proportion of people who accessed the Internet.

In 1999, the proportion of people using the Internet in the USA stood at about 20%. By contrast, the figures for Canada and Mexico were significantly lower, at around 10% and 5% respectively. However, in the year 2002, Canada overtook the USA in terms of the proportion of its citizens who went online.

In 2005, Internet usage in both the USA and Canada rose to around 70% of the population, while the figure for Mexico reached just over 25%. Four years later, in 2009, the percentage of Internet users was considerably higher in Candada than in the other two countries. In that year, almost 100% of Canadians used the Internet, compared to about 80% of Americans and only 40% of Mexicans.

Migration

The chart below shows figures for long-term international migration to and from the UK over a 10-year period.

The chart gives information about UK immigration, emigration and net migration between 1999 and 2008.

Both immigration and emigration rates rose over the period shown, but the figures for immigration were significantly higher. Net migration peaked in 2004 and 2007.

In 1999, over 450,000 people came to live in the UK, while the number of people who emigrated stood at just under 300,000. The figure for net migration was around 160,000, and it reamined at a similar level until 2003. From 1999 to 2004, the immigration rate rose by nearly 150,000 people, but there was a much smaller rise in emigration. Net migration peaked at almost 250,000 people in 2004.

After 2004, the rate of immigration remained high, but the number of people emigrating fluctuated. Emigration fell suddenly in 2007, before peaking at about 420,000 people in 2008. As a result, the net migration figure rose to around 240,000 in 2007, but fell back to around 160,000 in 2008.

entry.title: IELTS Speaking
entry.content:
Oral expression accumulation

Your vision was right.

A vision refers to a mental image or a dream, commonly used in the real world to refer to a personâ€™s ability to think about the future with imagination or intelligence.

Tai Lung has broken out of prison.
Do you feel stuck? Try to break out of your daily routine.
You broke out of your normal roles to accomplish something as a family.

It means to escapte from a place, aslo can be used figuratively, meaning to escape a situation.

He wasnâ€™t even meant to be here.

Contrastive stress. It means something wasnâ€™t planned or supposed to happen.

All good things come to an end.

When going through changes or losses in life, one can refer to this saying. It works as a reminder to appreciate the good moments because they will not always be there.

I donâ€™t like to use this phrase because itâ€™s offensive to our kind.

Oneâ€™s kind refers to people with whom we have things in common or who share a similar background to ours.

And if I go back, Max, itâ€™s the end of the line for me.

Something is the end of the line, it means that it has ended or that it wonâ€™t be possible to continue it and itâ€™s better to give it up.

Friends, I am afraid that I have some terrible news.
Iâ€™m afraid I canâ€™t help you. Itâ€™s gone, you know.
Well, Iâ€™m afraid Fiona isnâ€™t really warming up to Prince Charming.

It can be used when I have to introduce some sad or bad news. Also can be used as a synonym for Iâ€™m sorry.

Heâ€™s not going to eat us, weâ€™ve already been over it.
But first, letâ€™s go over the rules.

Going over something is the same as reviewing, examining, or checking something carefully.

We gotta save him. = We have got to save him.
You gotta be kidding me. = You got to be kidding me.

â€œwe have got toâ€ becomes â€œwe gottaâ€

Same way I found out your name.
And I intent to find out which.

To find out means to discover or to become aware and learn about sth.

So your mistake will be short-lived.
His experience as a professional lawyer was short-lived.

If sth is short-lived, it only lasts for a short period of time.

Iâ€™m all ears.

Iâ€™m all ears = Iâ€™m listening carefully.

Speaking practice by gpt-4

Chatgpt prompts: I want you to act as an IELTS speaking examiner. I will show you the question. Then I give a ambiguous answer which refers to my real situation. You should correct it and tell me how to express to the IELTS examiner more colloquially not complicatedly.

entry.title: Iterative Optimal Control for Robotics System
Lean English With Movies and TV Series
entry.content:
Translations mostly refers to gpt-4.

GPT prompts: I am watching movies now, can you explain the specific words or phrase which I donâ€™t understand? You should also give other examples.

Minions

Making their master happy was the tribeâ€™s very reason for existence.

a group of people of the same race, and with the same customs, language, religion, etc, living in a particular area and often led by a chief.

With the emergence of the Stone Age came the rise of a new species.

start to exist, to appear or become known

But keeping a boss, therein lies the rub.

Suggests that the real challenge or problem is in keeping a boss, therein lies the rub = that is where the problem is = thereâ€™s the rub.

The Minions took an instant liking to man.

happening immediately

Ancient Egypt held great promise.

Sth or sb showed a lot of potential or indicated (point out, show, be a sign of something) a high likelihood (the chance of sth happening; how likely sth is to happen) or future success

One particular employer took their failure very very badly.

Someone reacted strongly and negatively to their own failure or mistake, it implies a deep sense of disappointment, regret, or emotional pain in response to not succeeding or meeting oneâ€™s own expectations

And then, when all hope seemed lost, they found sanctuary.

A place of refuge (a condition or place of safety, where one is protected from danger, distress (it conveys a sense of extreme sorrow, suffering, or discomfort), or trouble.) or safety, a sanctuary can be a place where people or animals are protected and cannot be harmed or captured.

Years passed as the Minions forged their own civilization.

Implies a sense of active creation or shaping, often through hard work and determination, Minions built, developed, or established their own unique society or culture over time.

If this continued any longer, the Minions would perish.

Perish is a formal or literary word that means to die, especially in a sudden or terrible way, suggests a serious, dire (describes a situation or event that is extrmely serious or urgent, often involving great risk or suffering.) consequence, emphasizing the severity of the situation. The statement conveys a sense of urgency or danger, implying that the continuation of a certain event or circumstance would lead to the demise (refers to a personâ€™s death or the end of sthâ€™s existence or operation.) or extinction of the Minions.

Truth be told, Stuart had no idea what he was chosen for, but was thrilled it made people cheer for him.

Stuart was extremely excited, pleased or happy. It conveys a strong feeling of elation (a feeling of great joy) or joy.

Attend guest lectures from esteemed villains, make contacts in the underworld community.

Esteemed means highly respected or admired.

These adorable little freaks are headed to Orlando, too!

Tranditionally, freak can refer to sth very unusual or unexpected, sometimes carry a negative or derogatory(showing a critical or disrespectful attitude) connotation(additional meaning carries beyond its literal definition).

Dad! We got company! Itâ€™s because I tripped the alarm.

Got company is an informal way to say that someone is approaching or has arrived, typically in an unexpected or unwelcome manner.

What a small world! Hope weâ€™re not in rival gangs.

Potential conflicts or differences between the two people meeting.

Oh, Kevin, you donâ€™t wanna work for him! He ate his last henchmen!

Henchmen refers to loyal and subservient followers or helpers, expecially those who engage in criminal activities for a powerful leader or boss.

Ten times the evil in half the package.

This phrase describe sb/sth is extremely malevolent(having or showing a desire to harm other people) or harmful while being deceptively(likely to make you believe sth that is not true) small or unassuming in appearance.

You see this tiny little trinket?

Trinket refers to a small ornament(an object that is used as decoration in a room, garden/yard, etc. rather than for a particular purpose) or item of jewelry that is of little value.

Love the constume!

The clothes worn by actors in a play or movie, or worn by sb to make them look like sth else; The clothes worn by people from a particular place or during a particular historical period.

Buckle up, boys!

Literally, itâ€™s directive to fasten their seatbelts for safety. Figuratively, itâ€™s playful way to say â€œGet ready for an adventure!â€.

But right now, itâ€™s leaking radiation like you would not believe!

It means that radiation is being emitted or released from a particular source.
Like you would not believe is an idiomatic expression used to emphasize the extent or degree of sth.

Herb, these are the new recruits.

It refers to individuals who have recently joined a group, organization, team, or cause.

Right on! You guys are crazy little and way yellow, and I dig that!

Right on is an expression of strong support, approval, or encouragement.
Dig is another common slang term for like. For instance, I dug that movie.

Oh, I love England. The music, the fashion. Iâ€™m seriously thinking about overthrowing it someday.

Overthrowing refers to forcibly removing or displacing a system, government, ruler, or authority from power.

You can use it to hypnotize anyone. Anyone!

Hypnotize refers to the ability to put someone into a trance-like(a state in which sb seems to be asleep but is aware of what is said to them) state, making them susceptible(very likely to be influenced, harmed or affected by sb/sth) to suggestions or controlling their action, typically using a specific tool or method.

I feel like a proud mama with three dashing evil sons.

Attractive, confident, fashionable and elegant.

All the three little piggies had to do was just steal on little crown that the beautiful wolf had wanted ever since she was a penniless little street cub, unloved and abandoned.

Being penniless means she was without money, suggesting poverty or hardship. The term â€œstreet cubâ€œ implies she was young and alone, roaming the streets, likely fending for herself.

So the wolf huffed and puffed, and she blew them off the face of the earth!

The wolfâ€™s actions are described in a much more intense manner, suggesting that she completely obliterated(eliminate) or got rid of the pigs in a significant way.

Youâ€™re not allowed in without an adult. Scram, hooligans!

Scram is a colloquial(used in conversation but not in formal speech or writing) term that means â€œgo awayâ€ or â€œleave immediatelyâ€.
Hooligans refers to people, typically young, who are noisy, rowdy(making a lot of noise or likely to cause trouble), or disruptive.

This is a restricted area!

Restricted means access to this particular location or space is limited or controlled.

You think itâ€™s funny to mock the elderly, do you?

To mock sb means to ridicule(unkind comments that make fun of sb/sth or make them look silly), mimic(to copy the way sb speaks, moves, behaves, etc., especially in order to make other people laugh), or make fun of them, often in a mean-spirited or belittling(to make sb or the things that sb does seem unimportant) manner.

The Queenâ€™s crown has been kidnapped, Sarge!

Be taken against their will.

Bob, who appears to be a bald, jaundiced child, has pulled the famed sword right from its stone which legend dictates, makes him the new king.

Bald means people without hair on the head.
Jaundiced means Minions has yellow skin here.(Mostly a diease)
Legend dictates refers to what a well-known story or myth prescribes or sets as a standard.

Tiny yellow traitor!

A persion who betrays sb or sth, such as a friend, cause, or principle.

Iâ€™d wear a dress so sparkly, it glowed!

It glowed conveys a wish or a fantasy about wearing a dress that is exceptionally shiny or radiant.

And you pinheads screwed it up!

Screw it up is a slang expression meaning to make a mistake or mishandle a situation, resulting in negative consequences.

No, no, no, King Bob! You cannot just abdicate the throne!

Abdicate the throne means to relinquish(to stop having sth, especially when this happens unwillingly) or give up oneâ€™s position as a monarch or ruler.

If I wasnâ€™t so polite, Iâ€™d say this spells certain doom for the country.

Doom refers to an impending(going to happen very soon) negative or disastrous outcome.

Iâ€™m a dungeon master. Prepare for torture which I do.

Dungeon is a dark underground room used as a prison, especially in a castle.
Torture means the act of causing sb severe pain in order to punish them or make them say or do sth.

Oh, Iâ€™ve got a groovy idea!

Fashionable, attractive and interesting.

Mrs. Overkill, the hair in that picture, itâ€™s just two wavy lines!

Having curves, not straight.

Oh, so, what, now youâ€™re an art critic?

A person who expresses opinions about the good and bad qualities of books, music, etc.

The high collar and cinched waist reflect a simpler, more violent time.

High collar is a fashion detail, prevalent in different periods of history, often stands for formality, modesty, or status.
Cinched waist refers to a waist that has been made smaller or more slender by compression, often using corset or belts. Throughout history, a cinched or tighty-laced waist was beauty standard in various cultures, sybolizing femininity.

The material is a blend of taffeta and high-density body armor.

This is a crisp, smooth, plain woven fabric made from silk or synthetic fibers. Itâ€™s known for its shiny surface and is often used in evening dresses.

Must have tiny waist.

To have a slender or narrow waist.

Thanks for doing this, padre.
Come here, let me squeeze you! Oh, you are so squishy!

A person who is qualified to perform religious duties and ceremonies.
Squishy means soft and wet.

Villains, this is no longer a coronation! It is an execution!

Coronation refers to a ceremony where a monarch is formally crowned and inaugurated(the act of formally introducing or initiating sth, particularly with a ceremony ).
Execution refers to the act of killing sb, especially as a legal punishment.

And just for the record, my little deviled eggs, you can thank Kevin for what Iâ€™m about to do to you!

Deviled eggs traditionally refers to a dish made from hard-boiled eggs.

You imbecile! Have fun exploding!

Itâ€™s an offensive word used to insult someoneâ€™s intelligence or decision-making, implying they are stupid or foolish.

The countty owes you a great debt of gratitude.

Gratitude means a feeling of thankfulness or appreciation. Essentially, the statement is a formal way of saying â€œThank you for what youâ€™ve done for the country.â€

Bob, you were a wise and noble king for all of eight hours.

Noble describes sb with high moral principles, good character, and honor.

Ohï¼Œspectacular!

Very impressive.

For you, I have this beautiful, super-duper, incredible snow globe!

This is an informal term used to emphasize the greatness or impressiveness of sth. Itâ€™s a way of saying â€œreally greatâ€ or â€œexceptionalâ€.

For your bravery and valor, I am knighting you.

Valor refers to great courage in the face of danger, especially in battle.

Things look bleak, baby, Iâ€™m not gonna lie!

Bleak describes a situation that is not hopeful or encouraging, one that is gloomy(without much hope of success or happiness in the future), desolate(very lonely and unhappy), or dreary(makes you feel sad; dull and not interesting).

Are you really going to allow that little penguin to make off with my crown?

Make off means to leave quickly, especially to escape or to steal sth.

He was cunning, he was evil, he was perfect.

Cunning describes sb who is skilled in achieving their goals by deceit(dishonest behaviour that is intended to make sb believe sth that is not true) or evasion(the act of avoiding sb of avoiding sth that you are supposed to do). It suggests cleverness, especially in a sly(acting or done in a secret or dishonest way, often intending to trick people) or manipulative(Skilful at influencing sb or forcing sb to do what you want, often in an unfair way) way.

Angry Bird

I have no choice but to impose the maximum penalty allowed by the law.

Penalty refers to a punishment or consequence imposed for wrongdoing, violation, or offense. This punishment is typically given as a result of breaking rules or laws.

And Iâ€™m just super psyched to be taking this journey with you! Youâ€™re gonna have a blast.

Psyched is slang that means being very excited, enthusiastic, or eager about something.
Blast is slang for a great and enjoyable time or experience.

You have shared with us the wonders of your quaint, simple little island.

Quaint is adjective that describes sth as having an old-fashioned charm or being attractively unusual or peculiar(strange or unusual, especially in a way that is unpleasant or worrying) in design or appearance.

Say hello to the slingshot!

Slingshot refers a small handheld weapon that consists of a Y-shaped frame with an elastic band attached to the two top prongs.

The trampoline!

A piece of equipment that is used in gymnastics for doing jumps in the air.

I am famishedâ€¦ -itâ€™s chow time!

Famished is an adjective that means extremely hungry.

And now weâ€™ve come to the prestigious Palms district.

Prestigious is used to describe something that is admired or respected, often due to its high status, reputation, or importance.

My friend from the banquet.

A formal meal for a large number of people, usually for a special occasion.

Water is the softest thing, yet it can penetrate mountains and earth.

Penetrate means to pass into or through, often by overcoming resistance.

What the caterpillar calls the end, the world calls a butterfly.

It suggests that what may seem like an ending or a loss can actually be the start of something beautiful and new when viewed from a different perspective.

Thatâ€™s very lifelike.

Lifelike describes sth that closely resembles or imitates real life.

How do we know youâ€™re not fugitives of the law?

Fugitives refers to persons who are fleeing or escaping from custody (being held by police or other authorities, especially while awaiting trial), typically to avoid arrest or imprisonment. A fugitive can be someone who has committed a crime, is suspected of a crime, or has benn convicted and is avoiding serving their sentence.

You might want to shield your eyes from the sparkle of those trophies.

Trophies refers to prizes or awards given for a particular achievement.

Looking through binoculars, spying on old ladies.

Binoculars refers to an optical instrument with a lens for each eye, used for magnifying and viewing distant objects.

Thanks for your hospitality.

Hospitality refers to the friendly and generous reception and entertainment of guests, visitors, or strangers.

But how do we get from here to there? I am not aquatic in the least.

When referring to animals or plants, â€œaquaticâ€ means living or growing in water. In this context, when a person uses the term â€œaquatic,â€ they are metaphorically suggesting a natural ability or comfort in water, typically in activities like swimming.

Comeon, weâ€™re birds. Weâ€™re descended from dinosaurs.

Descended means to have originated from or be related to a particluar ancestor or past form.

And I donâ€™t need any clam, detached, happy birds.

Detached describes someone who is not emotionally involved or connected. A detached individual can seem indifferent, aloof, or distant.

I told you not to mess with me!

To comfront or challenge sb, oftern aggressively.(to tease or play a joke on sb in latter plot)

The treacherous birds have repaid our friendship with an unprovoked act of aggression.

Treacherous is used to describe someone or sth that is guilty of betrayal or deception(the act of deceiving or misleading someone). It implies untrustworthiness or unreliability.
Unprovoked describes an action that is done without any apparent reason or justification. It indicates that the act of aggression was initiated without any prior provocation (the act of doing or saying sth deliberately in order to make sb angry or upset) or reason from the other party.

Youâ€™re wrecking my houseâ€¦You wrecked my houesâ€¦Well, now weâ€™re even.

Wreck means to destroy or cause significant damage to sth.
Weâ€™re even is an idiomatic expression that means both parties are now equal in terms of debts or obligations (a duty or responsibility to undertake an action or a commitment), often after one person has retaliated or made up for a wrong done to them.

Iâ€™m not blushing. Iâ€™m just red.

Blushing refers to the involuntary reddening (the automatic or unintentional change in skin color to a reddish hue) of the face, usually triggered by emotions such as embarrassment, shame, or shyness.

You know, back when I was angry, that would have really ticked me off.

Ticked me off is an idiomatic expression that means made me angry or annoyed me.

How did you guys find the time to pull this off? This is why we went to go get pedicures, isnâ€™t it?
Nope. We got pedicures because weâ€™re worth it.

Pull this off is an idiomatic expression that means to successfully achieve or complete something, especially when faced with difficulties or challenges.
A pedicure is a cosmetic (pertains to enhancing or improving appearance) treatment for the feet and toenails.

Well, this just got awkward.
Thatâ€™ really insensitive.

Insensitive is used to describe sb or sth showing a lack of consideration for anotherâ€™s feelings, needs, or particular situations. It indicates a lack of empathy or awareness.

Want to go get a bite?
Forget it. Letâ€™s just go home.

Get a bite is an informal way of saying have something to eat or go out to eat.

Roommates! I canâ€™t wait to make a chores list.

The term chores list refers to a list of household tasks or duties that need to be completed.

Heâ€™s hatching a new plan.

Originally, hatching refers to the process by which an animal breaks out of an egg. In this context, it means that he is devising, forming, or coming up with a new plan or idea metaphorically.

A Million Miles Away

A hostile rocketâ€¦ mid-flight?

Hostile describe sth that is unfriendly or adversarial (involving people who are in opposition and who make attacks on each other) in nature.

Having a clear mind during an emergency is imperative.

It means vital importance or crucial, the statement emphasizes that itâ€™s essential to maintain a clear and focused mindset during emergency situations.

Iâ€™m busting my ass. My body hurts. I canâ€™t sleep.

The phrase is an informal and coarse (rude and offensive) expression that means working very hard or putting in a lot of effort, often to the physical or mental exhaustion.

Itâ€™s as though the whole place is sacred.

Sacred describes sth that is regarded with great respect and reverence (a feeling of great respect or admiration for sb/sth), expecially in a spiritual or religuous context.

I, too, had to work so hard. Tenacity is a superpower.

Tenacity refers to the quality of being very determined, persistent, or unyielding, even in the face of challenges or adversity (a difficult or unpleasant situation).

The safety divers, theyâ€™re only there as a precaution.

Precaution refers to a measure taken in advance to prevent something dangerous or undesirable from happening.

Any assistance from the divers will disqualify you.

Disqualify means to declare someone ineligible (not having the necessary qualifications to have or to do sth) or unfit to participate in a particular activity or to be considered for a particular honor due to a specific reason or action.

Flight director LeRoy Cain is now instructing controllers to get out their contingency procedures.

Contingency refers to a future event or circumstance that is possible but cannot be predicted with certainty or one that could cause problems.

A piece of foam insulation broke off the external tank and struck the left wing of the orbiter.

Foam insulation refers to a material used to insulate and protect various structures, particularly in aerospace contexts.

Folks down at the Selection Office, would like to have a word.

Folks down is an informal way to refer to the people or group of individuals at a particular location.

Zootopia

Fear. Treachery. Bloodlust. Thousands of years agoâ€¦ these were the forces that ruled our world. A world where prey were scared of predators.

Treachery refers to betrayal or deceptive action. It evokes a sense of mistrust and the idea that alliances could be easily broken, leading to chaos and conflict.
Bloodlust describes an intense an violent desire to kill or injure. It paints a picture of a world dominated by aggression and the desire for conquest.
Prey These are animals that are hunted and killed by other animals for food.
Predator These are animals that hunt, kill, and eat other animals. They are often at the top of the food chain and are seen as a threat to those lower down.

And predators had an uncontrollable biological urge to maim and maulâ€¦

Maim To injure severely, especially in such a way that part of the body is permanently damaged or disfigured.
Maul To handle or treat roughly, often causing injury. In the context of animals, it means to attack or injure by biting, striking, or tearing at.

Back them, the world was divided in two. Vicious predator or meek prey.

Vicious denotes sb/sth that is aggressive, cruel. or violent.
Meek describes sb/sth that is gentle, submissive, or lacking in force or assertiveness.

And every young mammal has multitudinous opportunities.

Multitudinous means very numerous or existing in great numbers.

I donâ€™t have to cower in a herd anymore.

To cower means to shrink away or crouch down, typically out of fear or submission.
A herd refers to a large group of animals, especially hoofed mammals, that live together or are kept together as livestock.

I donâ€™t have to be a lonely hunter anymore. Today, I can hunt for tax exemptions. Iâ€™m gonna be an actuary.

A tax exemption is a monetary exclusion that reduces the taxable income.
An actuary is a business professional who deals the financial impact of risk and uncertainty.

Carrot farming is a noble profession.

Noble means having or showing fine personal qualities or high moral principles.

Hey! You heard her. Cut it out.

When sb says cut it out, they are telling someone else to stop what they are doing, especially if it is annoying, troublesome, or inappropriate.

Nice costume, loser.

Costume refers to a set of clothes worn by an actor for a particular role or by sb attending a masquerade or a special event.

Listen up, cadets.

Cadets are individuals who are in training to become members of military organization or who are undergoing some form of structured training program, often in preparation for a future role in the military or a related field.

Filthy toilet! Youâ€™re dead, Fluff Butt.

Filthy is used to describe a toilet that is very dirty, unsanitary, or unclean.
Fluff refers soft animal fur or bird feathers, that is found especially on young animals or birds.

As mayor of Zootopia, I am proud to announce that my Mammal Inclusion Initiative has produced its first police academy graduate.

It suggests a program or policy that has been put in place to promote the inclusion of all mammals, regardless of their species, size, or other characteristics, in the society of Zootopia. The goal of this initiative is likely to ensure that mammals of all types are represented and have equal opportunities, particularly in professions like law enforcement, which is indicated by the mention of the police academy.

Valedictorian of her class, ZPDâ€™s very first rabbit officer, Judy Hopps!

The student who has the highest marks/grades in a particular group of students and who gives the valedictory speech at a graduation ceremony.

You play cribbage with a weasel.

Cribbage is a card game that involves playing and grouping cards in combinations to gain poing.
A weasel is a small mammal known for its slender body and keen hunting skills.

The deterrent and the repellent, thatâ€™s all she needs.

A deterrent is sth that discourages or is intended to discourage sb from doing sth. Itâ€™s often used in the context of preventing undesirable actions or behaviors by making them seem unappealing or risky.
A repellent is a substance that drives away certain things, often insects or animals.

Terrific! Everyone wins!

Terrific used to describe sth as extremely good. Itâ€™s an expression of enthusiasm and approval.

entry.title: Presentation Improvement
entry.content:
Using chatgpt to improve my English presentation.

Prompts:

I want you act as an English teacher to improve my presentation. You can give a topic to me. And I will give a paragraph by myself. After that, you must proofread and give advance and more correct expression to my essay. And rewrite it.

ğŸ’¡Activate Code Spell Checker plugins in VSCode

åŠå¹´å·¦å³æ›´æ–°ä¸€æ¬¡ã€‚

Robotics in Agriculture

I believe that robots can play an significant role in agriculture. For example, scientists can develop drones equipped with cameras to grow and monitor crops more effectively. These drones can inspect crops in a timely manner, detecting any issues such as pests or diseases. Additionally, they can precisely apply fertilizers or pesticides, thus reducing waste and minimizing environmental damage. Overall the use of robots in agriculture has the potential to increase productivity, reduce costs, and improve sustainability.

Regular Exercise

Ladies and gentlemen, today Iâ€™d like to discuss the myriad benefits of regular exercise. It is widely recognized that engaging in physical activity can do wonders for our bodies, both in terms of improving our physical fitness and bolstering our mental health.

One of the most well-known advantages of regular exercise is weight loss. Studies have shown that individuals who engage in regular physical activity are more likely to maintain a healthy weight and reduce their risk of obesity. Moreover, exercise has been linked to a decrease in the risk of a number of chronic illnesses, such as heart disease and type 2 diabetes.

But the benefits of exercise go beyond the physical realm. Regular exercise has been shown to promote better sleep, increase energy levels, and even enhance cognitive function, Furthermore, engaging in physical activity has been linked to decreased levels of anxiety and depression, and an overall improvement in mental health.

In my personal experience, I have found that playing basketball and boxing have had a profound impact on my overall well-being. These activities not only strengthen my body, but also invigorate my spirit and improve my concentration and productivity at work.

In conclusion, regular exercise is a powerful tool for improving our physical and mental health. By incorporating physical activity into our daily routines, we can reap the many rewards of a healthy and active lifestyle. Thank you for your attention.

The Impact of Artificial Intelligence on Health care

Artificial Intelligence is making a significant impact on various aspects of our daily lives, including health care. AI can provide prompt and straightforward preliminary diagnostics when we feel unwell, helping us understand our symptoms and identify potential health issues without having to visit a hospital for minor concerns.

AI also plays a crucial role in monitoring our overall health, offering personalized recommendations for nutrition and reminding us to engage in regular physical activity. In addition to these wellness applications, AI can provide valuable support during times of ailment.

For instance, AI-powered patient care can assist in administering medication and managing treatment plans, as well as offering companionship to alleviate feelings of solitary or isolation. These are just a few examples of how Artificial Intelligence is revolutionizing the health care landscape, improving the quality of care and empowering individuals to take control of their well-being.

The Impact of Technology on Society

Technology has always played a significant role in society, shaping it though changes in the means of production. Looking back through history, we can see how technology has had a profound impact. As we embrace a more convenient lifestyle, technology continues to evolve, constantly influencing and improving our lives.

One recent example of technological advancement is ChatGPT, an artificial intelligence model released by OpenAI a few months ago. Its introduction immediately captured worldwide attention. Futhermore, the rise of AI poses the possibility of certain jobs being substituted in the coming years. This trend is also observed in factories, where robots are gradually replacing human workers. While these developments inspire optimism about increased productivity and efficiency, they also raise concerns and uncertainties.

Looking ahead, it is evident that technology will present greater challenges in the future. However, I remain hopeful that technology, when harnessed responsibly, can contribute to building a happier society that benefits all.

Why Students should be Encouraged to Develop the Ability to Meet Challenges

Develop Studentsâ€™ Ability to Meet Challenges

In todayâ€™s rapidly evolving world, students must be encouraged to develop the ability to meet challenges. This essay explores several compelling reasons why students should cultivate this vital skill set. By acquiring the ability to confront and overcome challenges, students will not only survive but thrive in a dynamic and competitive environment.

First and foremost, developing the ability to meet challenges equips students with the necessary skills to adapt to a changing job market. As technological advancements like artificial intelligence reshape industries, traditional jobs are disappearing, and new professions are emerging. By fostering resilience and adaptability, students will be better prepared to navigate these transitions and seize new opportunities.

Furthermore, in todayâ€™s interconnected world, interdisciplinary knowledge is crucial. It is no longer sufficient to excel in a single domain; students must also possess a broad range of skills. The ability to meet challenges encourages students to explore diverse subjects, enabling them to approach problems from multiple perspectives. This interdisciplinary mindset enhance their creativity and problem-solving abilities, giving them a competitive edge in their future careers.

In addition to personal benefits, developing the ability to fave challenges contributes to society as a whole. Individuals who are adept at tackling obstacles are more likely to become proactive and productive members of their communities. They possess the determination and drive to overcome hurdles, effect positive change, and make significant contributions to societyâ€™s progress.

In conclusion, it is crucial to encourage students to develop the ability to meet challenges. By doing so, they will not only thrive in a rapidly changing world but also contribute to the betterment of society. Equipping students with resilience, adaptability, and interdisciplinary skills prepares them for the future, enabling them to overcome obstacles and seize opportunities with confidence.

entry.title: æ— äººæœºå®‰å…¨æ€§è®ºæ–‡ç¬”è®°
entry.content:
Neual-Fly enables rapid learning for agile flight in strong winds

é“¾æ¥

è®ºæ–‡ä¸­æåˆ°çš„æŠµæŠ—æœ€å¤§é£åŠ›æ˜¯43.6km/h, å³12.1m/s.

è®ºæ–‡æå‡ºäº†ä¸€ç§ data-driven approach. å«åš Neural-Fly. èƒ½å¤Ÿè¾¾åˆ°å˜ç±³çº§ç²¾åº¦çš„è¯¯å·®.

è¯¥ç®—æ³•çš„ä¸¤ä¸ªæ ¸å¿ƒ:

  • an offline learning phase;

  • an online adaptive control phase used as real-time online learning.
